commands.name: ffmpeg_find
commands.description: Get ffmpeg installation information

commands.name: get
commands.description: Download stream from a LBRY name.

arguments.name: uri
arguments.description: uri of the content to download

arguments.name: file_name
arguments.description: specified name for the downloaded file, overrides the stream file name

arguments.name: download_directory
arguments.description: full path to the directory to download into

arguments.name: timeout
arguments.description: download timeout in number of seconds

arguments.name: save_file
arguments.description: save the file to the downloads directory

arguments.name: wallet_id
arguments.description: wallet to check for claim purchase reciepts

commands.returns:
{
                "streaming_url": "(str) url to stream the file using range requests",
                "completed": "(bool) true if download is completed",
                "file_name": "(str) name of file",
                "download_directory": "(str) download directory",
                "points_paid": "(float) credit paid to download file",
                "stopped": "(bool) true if download is stopped",
                "stream_hash": "(str) stream hash of file",
                "stream_name": "(str) stream name",
                "suggested_file_name": "(str) suggested file name",
                "sd_hash": "(str) sd hash of file",
                "download_path": "(str) download path of file",
                "mime_type": "(str) mime type of file",
                "key": "(str) key attached to file",
                "total_bytes_lower_bound": "(int) lower bound file size in bytes",
                "total_bytes": "(int) file upper bound size in bytes",
                "written_bytes": "(int) written size in bytes",
                "blobs_completed": "(int) number of fully downloaded blobs",
                "blobs_in_stream": "(int) total blobs on stream",
                "blobs_remaining": "(int) total blobs remaining to download",
                "status": "(str) downloader status",
                "claim_id": "(str) None if claim is not found else the claim id",
                "txid": "(str) None if claim is not found else the transaction id",
                "nout": "(int) None if claim is not found else the transaction output index",
                "outpoint": "(str) None if claim is not found else the tx and output",
                "metadata": "(dict) None if claim is not found else the claim metadata",
                "channel_claim_id": "(str) None if claim is not found or not signed",
                "channel_name": "(str) None if claim is not found or not signed",
                "claim_name": "(str) None if claim is not found else the claim name",
                "reflector_progress": "(int) reflector upload progress, 0 to 100",
                "uploading_to_reflector": "(bool) set to True when currently uploading to reflector"
            }

commands.name: publish
commands.description: Create or replace a stream claim at a given name (use 'stream create/update' for more control).

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: name of the content (can only consist of a-z A-Z 0-9 and -(dash))

arguments.name: bid
arguments.description: amount to back the claim

arguments.name: file_path
arguments.description: path to file to be associated with name.

arguments.name: validate_file
arguments.description: validate that the video container and encodings match common web browser support or that optimization succeeds if specified. FFmpeg is required

arguments.name: optimize_file
arguments.description: transcode the video & audio if necessary to ensure common web browser support. FFmpeg is required

arguments.name: fee_currency
arguments.description: specify fee currency

arguments.name: fee_amount
arguments.description: content download fee

arguments.name: fee_address
arguments.description: address where to send fee payments, will use value from --claim_address if not provided

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: title of the publication

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: description of the publication

arguments.name: author
arguments.description: author of the publication. The usage for this field is not the same as for channels. The author field is used to credit an author who is not the publisher and is not represented by the channel. For example, a pdf file of 'The Odyssey' has an author of 'Homer' but may by published to a channel such as '@classics', or to no channel at all

arguments.name: tags
arguments.description: add content tags

arguments.name: languages
arguments.description: languages used by the channel, using RFC 5646 format, eg: for English `--languages=en` for Spanish (Spain) `--languages=es-ES` for Spanish (Mexican) `--languages=es-MX` for Chinese (Simplified) `--languages=zh-Hans` for Chinese (Traditional) `--languages=zh-Hant`

arguments.name: locations
arguments.description: locations relevant to the stream, consisting of 2 letter `country` code and a `state`, `city` and a postal `code` along with a `latitude` and `longitude`. for JSON RPC: pass a dictionary with aforementioned attributes as keys, eg: ... "locations": [{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}] ... for command line: pass a colon delimited list with values in the following order: "COUNTRY:STATE:CITY:CODE:LATITUDE:LONGITUDE" making sure to include colon for blank values, for example to provide only the city: ... --locations="::Manchester" with all values set: ... --locations="US:NH:Manchester:03101:42.990605:-71.460989" optionally, you can just pass the "LATITUDE:LONGITUDE": ... --locations="42.990605:-71.460989" finally, you can also pass JSON string of dictionary on the command line as you would via JSON RPC ... --locations="{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}"

arguments.name: license
arguments.description: publication license

arguments.name: license_url
arguments.description: publication license url

arguments.name: thumbnail_url
arguments.description: thumbnail url

arguments.name: release_time
arguments.description: original public release of content, seconds since UNIX epoch

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: image/video width, automatically calculated from media file

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: image/video height, automatically calculated from media file

arguments.name: duration
arguments.description: audio/video duration in seconds, automatically calculated

arguments.name: channel_id
arguments.description: claim id of the publisher channel

arguments.name: channel_name
arguments.description: name of publisher channel

arguments.name: channel_account_id
arguments.description: one or more account ids for accounts to look in for channel certificates, defaults to all accounts.

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: account to use for holding the transaction

arguments.name: wallet_id
arguments.description: restrict operation to specific wallet

arguments.name: funding_account_ids
arguments.description: ids of accounts to fund this transaction

arguments.name: claim_address
arguments.description: address where the claim is sent to, if not specified it will be determined automatically from the account

arguments.name: preview
arguments.description: do not broadcast the transaction

arguments.name: blocking
arguments.description: wait until transaction is in mempool

examples.title: Publish a file
examples.curl: curl -d'{"method": "publish", "params": {"name": "a-new-stream", "bid": "1.0", "file_path": "/tmp/tmplzrrnpu1", "validate_file": false, "optimize_file": false, "tags": [], "languages": [], "locations": [], "channel_account_id": [], "funding_account_ids": [], "preview": false, "blocking": false}}' http://localhost:5279/
examples.python: requests.post("http://localhost:5279", json={"method": "publish", "params": {"name": "a-new-stream", "bid": "1.0", "file_path": "/tmp/tmplzrrnpu1", "validate_file": false, "optimize_file": false, "tags": [], "languages": [], "locations": [], "channel_account_id": [], "funding_account_ids": [], "preview": false, "blocking": false}}).json()

commands.name: resolve
commands.description: Get the claim that a URL refers to.

arguments.name: urls
arguments.description: one or more urls to resolve

arguments.name: wallet_id
arguments.description: wallet to check for claim purchase reciepts

arguments.name: new_sdk_server
arguments.description: URL of the new SDK server (EXPERIMENTAL)

arguments.name: include_purchase_receipt
arguments.description: lookup and include a receipt if this wallet has purchased the claim being resolved

arguments.name: include_is_my_output
arguments.description: lookup and include a boolean indicating if claim being resolved is yours

arguments.name: include_sent_supports
arguments.description: lookup and sum the total amount of supports you've made to this claim

arguments.name: include_sent_tips
arguments.description: lookup and sum the total amount of tips you've made to this claim (only makes sense when claim is not yours)

arguments.name: include_received_tips
arguments.description: lookup and sum the total amount of tips you've received to this claim (only makes sense when claim is yours)

commands.returns:
Dictionary of results, keyed by url
    '<url>': {
            If a resolution error occurs:
            'error': Error message

            If the url resolves to a channel or a claim in a channel:
            'certificate': {
                'address': (str) claim address,
                'amount': (float) claim amount,
                'effective_amount': (float) claim amount including supports,
                'claim_id': (str) claim id,
                'claim_sequence': (int) claim sequence number (or -1 if unknown),
                'decoded_claim': (bool) whether or not the claim value was decoded,
                'height': (int) claim height,
                'confirmations': (int) claim depth,
                'timestamp': (int) timestamp of the block that included this claim tx,
                'has_signature': (bool) included if decoded_claim
                'name': (str) claim name,
                'permanent_url': (str) permanent url of the certificate claim,
                'supports: (list) list of supports [{'txid': (str) txid,
                                                     'nout': (int) nout,
                                                     'amount': (float) amount}],
                'txid': (str) claim txid,
                'nout': (str) claim nout,
                'signature_is_valid': (bool), included if has_signature,
                'value': ClaimDict if decoded, otherwise hex string
            }

            If the url resolves to a channel:
            'claims_in_channel': (int) number of claims in the channel,

            If the url resolves to a claim:
            'claim': {
                'address': (str) claim address,
                'amount': (float) claim amount,
                'effective_amount': (float) claim amount including supports,
                'claim_id': (str) claim id,
                'claim_sequence': (int) claim sequence number (or -1 if unknown),
                'decoded_claim': (bool) whether or not the claim value was decoded,
                'height': (int) claim height,
                'depth': (int) claim depth,
                'has_signature': (bool) included if decoded_claim
                'name': (str) claim name,
                'permanent_url': (str) permanent url of the claim,
                'channel_name': (str) channel name if claim is in a channel
                'supports: (list) list of supports [{'txid': (str) txid,
                                                     'nout': (int) nout,
                                                     'amount': (float) amount}]
                'txid': (str) claim txid,
                'nout': (str) claim nout,
                'signature_is_valid': (bool), included if has_signature,
                'value': ClaimDict if decoded, otherwise hex string
            }
    }

examples.title: Resolve a claim
examples.curl: curl -d'{"method": "resolve", "params": {"urls": ["astream#b184691589549834b2ec8119b6a274387eec23c8"], "include_purchase_receipt": false, "include_is_my_output": false, "include_sent_supports": false, "include_sent_tips": false, "include_received_tips": false}}' http://localhost:5279/
examples.python: requests.post("http://localhost:5279", json={"method": "resolve", "params": {"urls": ["astream#b184691589549834b2ec8119b6a274387eec23c8"], "include_purchase_receipt": false, "include_is_my_output": false, "include_sent_supports": false, "include_sent_tips": false, "include_received_tips": false}}).json()

account.doc: Create, modify and inspect wallet accounts.

commands.name: account_add
commands.description:
Add a previously created account from a seed, private key or public key (read-only).
Specify --single_key for single address or vanity address accounts.

arguments.name: account_name
arguments.description: name of the account to add

arguments.name: seed
arguments.description: seed to generate new account from

arguments.name: private_key
arguments.description: private key for new account

arguments.name: public_key
arguments.description: public key for new account

arguments.name: single_key
arguments.description: create single key account, default is multi-key

arguments.name: wallet_id
arguments.description: restrict operation to specific wallet

commands.returns:
{
                "id": "account_id",
                "is_default": "this account is used by default",
                "ledger": "name of crypto currency and network",
                "name": "optional account name",
                "seed": "human friendly words from which account can be recreated",
                "encrypted": "if account is encrypted",
                "private_key": "extended private key",
                "public_key": "extended public key",
                "address_generator": "settings for generating addresses",
                "modified_on": "date of last modification to account settings"
            }

examples.title: Add an account from seed
examples.curl: curl -d'{"method": "account_add", "params": {"account_name": "new account", "seed": "prepare pulse mesh road divorce require agent broken prison happy write salon", "single_key": false}}' http://localhost:5279/
examples.lbrynet: lbrynet account add "new account" --seed="prepare pulse mesh road divorce require agent broken prison happy write salon"
examples.python: requests.post("http://localhost:5279", json={"method": "account_add", "params": {"account_name": "new account", "seed": "prepare pulse mesh road divorce require agent broken prison happy write salon", "single_key": false}}).json()

You can also spread the transfer across a number of --outputs (cannot
be used together with --everything).

of the longest such range: for change and receiving address chains. This is
useful to figure out ideal values to set for 'receiving_gap' and 'change_gap'
account settings.

commands.name: channel_create
commands.description: Create a new channel by generating a channel private key and establishing an '@' prefixed claim.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: name of the channel prefixed with '@'

arguments.name: bid
arguments.description: amount to back the claim

arguments.name: allow_duplicate_name
arguments.description: create new channel even if one already exists with given name. default: false.

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: title of the publication

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: description of the publication

arguments.name: email
arguments.description: email of channel owner

arguments.name: website_url
arguments.description: website url

arguments.name: featured
arguments.description: claim_ids of featured content in channel

arguments.name: tags
arguments.description: content tags

arguments.name: languages
arguments.description: languages used by the channel, using RFC 5646 format, eg: for English `--languages=en` for Spanish (Spain) `--languages=es-ES` for Spanish (Mexican) `--languages=es-MX` for Chinese (Simplified) `--languages=zh-Hans` for Chinese (Traditional) `--languages=zh-Hant`

arguments.name: locations
arguments.description: locations of the channel, consisting of 2 letter `country` code and a `state`, `city` and a postal `code` along with a `latitude` and `longitude`. for JSON RPC: pass a dictionary with aforementioned attributes as keys, eg: ... "locations": [{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}] ... for command line: pass a colon delimited list with values in the following order: "COUNTRY:STATE:CITY:CODE:LATITUDE:LONGITUDE" making sure to include colon for blank values, for example to provide only the city: ... --locations="::Manchester" with all values set: ... --locations="US:NH:Manchester:03101:42.990605:-71.460989" optionally, you can just pass the "LATITUDE:LONGITUDE": ... --locations="42.990605:-71.460989" finally, you can also pass JSON string of dictionary on the command line as you would via JSON RPC ... --locations="{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}"

arguments.name: thumbnail_url
arguments.description: thumbnail url

arguments.name: cover_url
arguments.description: url of cover image

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: account to use for holding the transaction

arguments.name: wallet_id
arguments.description: restrict operation to specific wallet

arguments.name: funding_account_ids
arguments.description: ids of accounts to fund this transaction

arguments.name: claim_address
arguments.description: address where the channel is sent to, if not specified it will be determined automatically from the account

arguments.name: preview
arguments.description: do not broadcast the transaction

arguments.name: blocking
arguments.description: wait until transaction is in mempool

commands.name: channel_update
commands.description: Update an existing channel claim.

arguments.name: claim_id
arguments.description: claim_id of the channel to update

arguments.name: bid
arguments.description: amount to back the claim

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: title of the publication

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: description of the publication

arguments.name: email
arguments.description: email of channel owner

arguments.name: website_url
arguments.description: website url

arguments.name: featured
arguments.description: claim_ids of featured content in channel

arguments.name: clear_featured
arguments.description: clear existing featured content (prior to adding new ones)

arguments.name: tags
arguments.description: add content tags

arguments.name: clear_tags
arguments.description: clear existing tags (prior to adding new ones)

arguments.name: languages
arguments.description: languages used by the channel, using RFC 5646 format, eg: for English `--languages=en` for Spanish (Spain) `--languages=es-ES` for Spanish (Mexican) `--languages=es-MX` for Chinese (Simplified) `--languages=zh-Hans` for Chinese (Traditional) `--languages=zh-Hant`

arguments.name: clear_languages
arguments.description: clear existing languages (prior to adding new ones)

arguments.name: locations
arguments.description: locations of the channel, consisting of 2 letter `country` code and a `state`, `city` and a postal `code` along with a `latitude` and `longitude`. for JSON RPC: pass a dictionary with aforementioned attributes as keys, eg: ... "locations": [{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}] ... for command line: pass a colon delimited list with values in the following order: "COUNTRY:STATE:CITY:CODE:LATITUDE:LONGITUDE" making sure to include colon for blank values, for example to provide only the city: ... --locations="::Manchester" with all values set: ... --locations="US:NH:Manchester:03101:42.990605:-71.460989" optionally, you can just pass the "LATITUDE:LONGITUDE": ... --locations="42.990605:-71.460989" finally, you can also pass JSON string of dictionary on the command line as you would via JSON RPC ... --locations="{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}"

arguments.name: clear_locations
arguments.description: clear existing locations (prior to adding new ones)

arguments.name: thumbnail_url
arguments.description: thumbnail url

arguments.name: cover_url
arguments.description: url of cover image

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: account in which to look for channel (default: all)

arguments.name: wallet_id
arguments.description: restrict operation to specific wallet

arguments.name: funding_account_ids
arguments.description: ids of accounts to fund this transaction

arguments.name: claim_address
arguments.description: address where the channel is sent

arguments.name: new_signing_key
arguments.description: generate a new signing key, will invalidate all previous publishes

arguments.name: preview
arguments.description: do not broadcast the transaction

arguments.name: blocking
arguments.description: wait until transaction is in mempool

arguments.name: replace
arguments.description: instead of modifying specific values on the channel, this will clear all existing values and only save passed in values, useful for form submissions where all values are always set

commands.name: claim_search
commands.description:
Search for stream and channel claims on the blockchain.

Arguments marked with "supports equality constraints" allow prepending the
value with an equality constraint such as '>', '>=', '<' and '<='
eg. --height=">400000" would limit results to only claims above 400k block height.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: claim name (normalized)

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: full text search

arguments.name: claim_id
arguments.description: full or partial claim id

arguments.name: claim_ids
arguments.description: list of full claim ids

arguments.name: txid
arguments.description: transaction id

arguments.name: nout
arguments.description: position in the transaction

arguments.name: channel
arguments.description: claims signed by this channel (argument is a URL which automatically gets resolved), see --channel_ids if you need to filter by multiple channels at the same time, includes claims with invalid signatures, use in conjunction with --valid_channel_signature

arguments.name: channel_ids
arguments.description: claims signed by any of these channels (arguments must be claim ids of the channels), includes claims with invalid signatures, implies --has_channel_signature, use in conjunction with --valid_channel_signature

arguments.name: not_channel_ids
arguments.description: exclude claims signed by any of these channels (arguments must be claim ids of the channels)

arguments.name: has_channel_signature
arguments.description: claims with a channel signature (valid or invalid)

arguments.name: valid_channel_signature
arguments.description: claims with a valid channel signature or no signature, use in conjunction with --has_channel_signature to only get claims with valid signatures

arguments.name: invalid_channel_signature
arguments.description: claims with invalid channel signature or no signature, use in conjunction with --has_channel_signature to only get claims with invalid signatures

arguments.name: limit_claims_per_channel
arguments.description: only return up to the specified number of claims per channel

arguments.name: is_controlling
arguments.description: winning claims of their respective name

arguments.name: public_key_id
arguments.description: only return channels having this public key id, this is the same key as used in the wallet file to map channel certificate private keys: {'public_key_id': 'private key'}

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: last updated block height (supports equality constraints)

arguments.name: timestamp
arguments.description: last updated timestamp (supports equality constraints)

arguments.name: creation_height
arguments.description: created at block height (supports equality constraints)

arguments.name: creation_timestamp
arguments.description: created at timestamp (supports equality constraints)

arguments.name: activation_height
arguments.description: height at which claim starts competing for name (supports equality constraints)

arguments.name: expiration_height
arguments.description: height at which claim will expire (supports equality constraints)

arguments.name: release_time
arguments.description: limit to claims self-described as having been released to the public on or after this UTC timestamp, when claim does not provide a release time the publish time is used instead (supports equality constraints)

arguments.name: amount
arguments.description: limit by claim value (supports equality constraints)

arguments.name: support_amount
arguments.description: limit by supports and tips received (supports equality constraints)

arguments.name: effective_amount
arguments.description: limit by total value (initial claim value plus all tips and supports received), this amount is blank until claim has reached activation height (supports equality constraints)

arguments.name: trending_group
arguments.description: group numbers 1 through 4 representing the trending groups of the content: 4 means content is trending globally and independently, 3 means content is not trending globally but is trending independently (locally), 2 means it is trending globally but not independently and 1 means it's not trending globally or locally (supports equality constraints)

arguments.name: trending_mixed
arguments.description: trending amount taken from the global or local value depending on the trending group: 4 - global value, 3 - local value, 2 - global value, 1 - local value (supports equality constraints)

arguments.name: trending_local
arguments.description: trending value calculated relative only to the individual contents past history (supports equality constraints)

arguments.name: trending_global
arguments.description: trending value calculated relative to all trending content globally (supports equality constraints)

arguments.name: reposted_claim_id
arguments.description: all reposts of the specified original claim id

arguments.name: reposted
arguments.description: claims reposted this many times (supports equality constraints)

arguments.name: claim_type
arguments.description: filter by 'channel', 'stream' or 'unknown'

arguments.name: stream_types
arguments.description: filter by 'video', 'image', 'document', etc

arguments.name: media_types
arguments.description: filter by 'video/mp4', 'image/png', etc

arguments.name: fee_currency
arguments.description: specify fee currency: LBC, BTC, USD

arguments.name: fee_amount
arguments.description: content download fee (supports equality constraints)

arguments.name: duration
arguments.description: duration of video or audio in seconds (supports equality constraints)

arguments.name: any_tags
arguments.description: find claims containing any of the tags

arguments.name: all_tags
arguments.description: find claims containing every tag

arguments.name: not_tags
arguments.description: find claims not containing any of these tags

arguments.name: any_languages
arguments.description: find claims containing any of the languages

arguments.name: all_languages
arguments.description: find claims containing every language

arguments.name: not_languages
arguments.description: find claims not containing any of these languages

arguments.name: any_locations
arguments.description: find claims containing any of the locations

arguments.name: all_locations
arguments.description: find claims containing every location

arguments.name: not_locations
arguments.description: find claims not containing any of these locations

arguments.name: page
arguments.description: page to return during paginating

arguments.name: page_size
arguments.description: number of items on page during pagination

arguments.name: order_by
arguments.description: field to order by, default is descending order, to do an ascending order prepend ^ to the field name, eg. '^amount' available fields: 'name', 'height', 'release_time', 'publish_time', 'amount', 'effective_amount', 'support_amount', 'trending_group', 'trending_mixed', 'trending_local', 'trending_global', 'activation_height'

arguments.name: no_totals
arguments.description: do not calculate the total number of pages and items in result set (significant performance boost)

arguments.name: wallet_id
arguments.description: wallet to check for claim purchase reciepts

arguments.name: include_purchase_receipt
arguments.description: lookup and include a receipt if this wallet has purchased the claim

arguments.name: include_is_my_output
arguments.description: lookup and include a boolean indicating if claim being resolved is yours

arguments.name: new_sdk_server
arguments.description: URL of the new SDK server (EXPERIMENTAL)

commands.name: collection_create
commands.description: Create a new collection.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: name of the collection

arguments.name: bid
arguments.description: amount to back the claim

arguments.name: claims
arguments.description: claim ids to be included in the collection

arguments.name: allow_duplicate_name
arguments.description: create new collection even if one already exists with given name. default: false.

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: title of the collection

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: description of the collection

arguments.name: tags
arguments.description: content tags

arguments.name: clear_languages
arguments.description: clear existing languages (prior to adding new ones)

arguments.name: languages
arguments.description: languages used by the collection, using RFC 5646 format, eg: for English `--languages=en` for Spanish (Spain) `--languages=es-ES` for Spanish (Mexican) `--languages=es-MX` for Chinese (Simplified) `--languages=zh-Hans` for Chinese (Traditional) `--languages=zh-Hant`

arguments.name: locations
arguments.description: locations of the collection, consisting of 2 letter `country` code and a `state`, `city` and a postal `code` along with a `latitude` and `longitude`. for JSON RPC: pass a dictionary with aforementioned attributes as keys, eg: ... "locations": [{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}] ... for command line: pass a colon delimited list with values in the following order: "COUNTRY:STATE:CITY:CODE:LATITUDE:LONGITUDE" making sure to include colon for blank values, for example to provide only the city: ... --locations="::Manchester" with all values set: ... --locations="US:NH:Manchester:03101:42.990605:-71.460989" optionally, you can just pass the "LATITUDE:LONGITUDE": ... --locations="42.990605:-71.460989" finally, you can also pass JSON string of dictionary on the command line as you would via JSON RPC ... --locations="{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}"

arguments.name: thumbnail_url
arguments.description: thumbnail url

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: account to use for holding the transaction

arguments.name: wallet_id
arguments.description: restrict operation to specific wallet

arguments.name: funding_account_ids
arguments.description: ids of accounts to fund this transaction

arguments.name: claim_address
arguments.description: address where the collection is sent to, if not specified it will be determined automatically from the account

arguments.name: preview
arguments.description: do not broadcast the transaction

arguments.name: blocking
arguments.description: wait until transaction is in mempool

                        "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                        "amount": "value of the txo as a decimal",
                        "address": "address of who can spend the txo",
                        "confirmations": "number of confirmed blocks",
                        "is_change": "payment to change address, only available when it can be determined",
                        "is_received": "true if txo was sent from external account to this account",
                        "is_spent": "true if txo is spent",
                        "is_mine": "payment to one of your accounts, only available when it can be determined",
                        "type": "one of 'claim', 'support' or 'purchase'",
                        "name": "when type is 'claim' or 'support', this is the claim name",
                        "claim_id": "when type is 'claim', 'support' or 'purchase', this is the claim id",
                        "claim_op": "when type is 'claim', this determines if it is 'create' or 'update'",
                        "value": "when type is 'claim' or 'support' with payload, this is the decoded protobuf payload",
                        "value_type": "determines the type of the 'value' field: 'channel', 'stream', etc",
                        "protobuf": "hex encoded raw protobuf version of 'value' field",
                        "permanent_url": "when type is 'claim' or 'support', this is the long permanent claim URL",
                        "claim": "for purchase outputs only, metadata of purchased claim",
                        "reposted_claim": "for repost claims only, metadata of claim being reposted",
                        "signing_channel": "for signed claims only, metadata of signing channel",
                        "is_channel_signature_valid": "for signed claims only, whether signature is valid",
                        "purchase_receipt": "metadata for the purchase transaction associated with this claim"
                    }
                ],
                "total_input": "sum of inputs as a decimal",
                "total_output": "sum of outputs, sans fee, as a decimal",
                "total_fee": "fee amount",
                "hex": "entire transaction encoded in hex"
            }

examples.title: Abandon a comment

commands.name: comment_create
commands.description: Create and associate a comment with a claim using your channel identity.

arguments.name: comment
arguments.description: Comment to be made, should be at most 2000 characters.

arguments.name: claim_id
arguments.description: The ID of the claim to comment on

arguments.name: parent_id
arguments.description: The ID of a comment to make a response to

arguments.name: channel_id
arguments.description: The ID of the channel you want to post under

arguments.name: channel_name
arguments.description: The channel you want to post as, prepend with a '@'

arguments.name: channel_account_id
arguments.description: one or more account ids for accounts to look in for channel certificates, defaults to all accounts

arguments.name: wallet_id
arguments.description: restrict operation to specific wallet

commands.returns:
(dict) Comment object if successfully made, (None) otherwise
    {
        "comment":      (str) The actual string as inputted by the user,
        "comment_id":   (str) The Comment's unique identifier,
        "channel_name": (str) Name of the channel this was posted under, prepended with a '@',
        "channel_id":   (str) The Channel Claim ID that this comment was posted under,
        "signature":    (str) The signature of the comment,
        "signing_ts":   (str) The timestamp used to sign the comment,
        "channel_url":  (str) Channel's URI in the ClaimTrie,
        "parent_id":    (str) Comment this is replying to, (None) if this is the root,
        "timestamp":    (int) The time at which comment was entered into the server at, in nanoseconds.
    }

examples.title: Posting a comment as your channel
examples.lbrynet: lbrynet comment create --comment="Thank you Based God" --channel_name=@channel --claim_id=b184691589549834b2ec8119b6a274387eec23c8

examples.curl: curl -d'{"method": "comment_create", "params": {"comment": "I have photographic evidence confirming Sasquatch exists", "parent_id": "4565d56defba657e29cc4dd5c8375681281277b04389ed12b6e434da32ad8bc2", "channel_name": "@channel", "channel_account_id": []}}' http://localhost:5279/

arguments.description: get file with matching claim outpoint(s)

arguments.description: get file with matching download path

arguments.description: get files currently uploading to reflector

arguments.description: get files that have been uploaded to reflector

arguments.name: blobs_remaining
arguments.description: amount of remaining blobs to download

arguments.description: number of items on page during pagination

commands.returns:
{
                "page": "Page number of the current items.",

                "total_pages": "Total number of pages.",
                "total_items": "Total number of items.",
                "items": [
                    {
                        "streaming_url": "(str) url to stream the file using range requests",
                        "completed": "(bool) true if download is completed",
                        "file_name": "(str) name of file",
                        "download_directory": "(str) download directory",
                        "points_paid": "(float) credit paid to download file",
                        "stopped": "(bool) true if download is stopped",
                        "stream_hash": "(str) stream hash of file",
                        "stream_name": "(str) stream name",
                        "suggested_file_name": "(str) suggested file name",
                        "sd_hash": "(str) sd hash of file",
                        "download_path": "(str) download path of file",
                        "mime_type": "(str) mime type of file",
                        "key": "(str) key attached to file",
                        "total_bytes_lower_bound": "(int) lower bound file size in bytes",
                        "total_bytes": "(int) file upper bound size in bytes",
                        "written_bytes": "(int) written size in bytes",
                        "blobs_completed": "(int) number of fully downloaded blobs",
                        "blobs_in_stream": "(int) total blobs on stream",
                        "blobs_remaining": "(int) total blobs remaining to download",
                        "status": "(str) downloader status",
                        "claim_id": "(str) None if claim is not found else the claim id",
                        "txid": "(str) None if claim is not found else the transaction id",
                        "nout": "(int) None if claim is not found else the transaction output index",
                        "outpoint": "(str) None if claim is not found else the tx and output",
                        "metadata": "(dict) None if claim is not found else the claim metadata",
                        "channel_claim_id": "(str) None if claim is not found or not signed",
                        "channel_name": "(str) None if claim is not found or not signed",
                        "claim_name": "(str) None if claim is not found else the claim name",
                        "reflector_progress": "(int) reflector upload progress, 0 to 100",
                        "uploading_to_reflector": "(bool) set to True when currently uploading to reflector"
                    }
                ]
            }

arguments.name: validate_file
arguments.description: validate that the video container and encodings match common web browser support or that optimization succeeds if specified. FFmpeg is required

arguments.name: optimize_file
arguments.description: transcode the video & audio if necessary to ensure common web browser support. FFmpeg is required

arguments.name: allow_duplicate_name
arguments.description: create new claim even if one already exists with given name. default: false.

arguments.name: fee_currency
arguments.description: specify fee currency

arguments.name: fee_amount
arguments.description: content download fee

arguments.name: fee_address
arguments.description: address where to send fee payments, will use value from --claim_address if not provided

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: title of the publication

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: description of the publication

arguments.name: author
arguments.description: author of the publication. The usage for this field is not the same as for channels. The author field is used to credit an author who is not the publisher and is not represented by the channel. For example, a pdf file of 'The Odyssey' has an author of 'Homer' but may by published to a channel such as '@classics', or to no channel at all

arguments.name: tags
arguments.description: add content tags

arguments.name: languages
arguments.description: languages used by the channel, using RFC 5646 format, eg: for English `--languages=en` for Spanish (Spain) `--languages=es-ES` for Spanish (Mexican) `--languages=es-MX` for Chinese (Simplified) `--languages=zh-Hans` for Chinese (Traditional) `--languages=zh-Hant`

arguments.name: locations
arguments.description: locations relevant to the stream, consisting of 2 letter `country` code and a `state`, `city` and a postal `code` along with a `latitude` and `longitude`. for JSON RPC: pass a dictionary with aforementioned attributes as keys, eg: ... "locations": [{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}] ... for command line: pass a colon delimited list with values in the following order: "COUNTRY:STATE:CITY:CODE:LATITUDE:LONGITUDE" making sure to include colon for blank values, for example to provide only the city: ... --locations="::Manchester" with all values set: ... --locations="US:NH:Manchester:03101:42.990605:-71.460989" optionally, you can just pass the "LATITUDE:LONGITUDE": ... --locations="42.990605:-71.460989" finally, you can also pass JSON string of dictionary on the command line as you would via JSON RPC ... --locations="{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}"

arguments.name: license
arguments.description: publication license

arguments.name: license_url
arguments.description: publication license url

arguments.name: thumbnail_url
arguments.description: thumbnail url

arguments.name: release_time
arguments.description: original public release of content, seconds since UNIX epoch

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: image/video width, automatically calculated from media file

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: image/video height, automatically calculated from media file

arguments.name: duration
arguments.description: audio/video duration in seconds, automatically calculated

arguments.name: channel_id
arguments.description: claim id of the publisher channel

arguments.name: channel_name
arguments.description: name of the publisher channel

arguments.name: channel_account_id
arguments.description: one or more account ids for accounts to look in for channel certificates, defaults to all accounts.

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: account to use for holding the transaction

arguments.name: wallet_id
arguments.description: restrict operation to specific wallet

arguments.name: funding_account_ids
arguments.description: ids of accounts to fund this transaction

arguments.name: claim_address
arguments.description: address where the claim is sent to, if not specified it will be determined automatically from the account

arguments.name: preview
arguments.description: do not broadcast the transaction

arguments.name: blocking
arguments.description: wait until transaction is in mempool

examples.title: Create a stream claim without metadata
examples.curl: curl -d'{"method": "stream_create", "params": {"name": "astream", "bid": "1.0", "file_path": "/tmp/tmp0fr7f0o8", "validate_file": false, "optimize_file": false, "tags": [], "languages": [], "locations": [], "channel_account_id": [], "funding_account_ids": [], "preview": false, "blocking": false}}' http://localhost:5279/
examples.python: requests.post("http://localhost:5279", json={"method": "stream_create", "params": {"name": "astream", "bid": "1.0", "file_path": "/tmp/tmp0fr7f0o8", "validate_file": false, "optimize_file": false, "tags": [], "languages": [], "locations": [], "channel_account_id": [], "funding_account_ids": [], "preview": false, "blocking": false}}).json()

commands.name: stream_list
commands.description: List my stream claims.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: stream name

arguments.name: claim_id
arguments.description: stream id

arguments.name: is_spent
arguments.description: shows previous stream updates and abandons

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: id of the account to query

arguments.name: wallet_id
arguments.description: restrict results to specific wallet

arguments.name: page
arguments.description: page to return during paginating

arguments.name: page_size
arguments.description: number of items on page during pagination

arguments.name: resolve
arguments.description: resolves each stream to provide additional metadata

arguments.name: no_totals
arguments.description: do not calculate the total number of pages and items in result set (significant performance boost)

commands.name: stream_repost
commands.description: Creates a claim that references an existing stream by its claim id.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: name of the content (can only consist of a-z A-Z 0-9 and -(dash))

arguments.name: bid
arguments.description: amount to back the claim

arguments.name: claim_id
arguments.description: id of the claim being reposted

arguments.name: allow_duplicate_name
arguments.description: create new claim even if one already exists with given name. default: false.

arguments.name: channel_id
arguments.description: claim id of the publisher channel

arguments.name: channel_name
arguments.description: name of the publisher channel

arguments.name: channel_account_id
arguments.description: one or more account ids for accounts to look in for channel certificates, defaults to all accounts.

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: account to use for holding the transaction

arguments.name: wallet_id
arguments.description: restrict operation to specific wallet

arguments.name: funding_account_ids
arguments.description: ids of accounts to fund this transaction

arguments.name: claim_address
arguments.description: address where the claim is sent to, if not specified it will be determined automatically from the account

arguments.name: preview
arguments.description: do not broadcast the transaction

arguments.name: blocking
arguments.description: wait until transaction is in mempool

commands.name: stream_update
commands.description: Update an existing stream claim and if a new file is provided announce it to lbrynet.

arguments.name: claim_id
arguments.description: id of the stream claim to update

arguments.name: bid
arguments.description: amount to back the claim

arguments.name: file_path
arguments.description: path to file to be associated with name.

arguments.name: validate_file
arguments.description: validate that the video container and encodings match common web browser support or that optimization succeeds if specified. FFmpeg is required and file_path must be specified.

arguments.name: optimize_file
arguments.description: transcode the video & audio if necessary to ensure common web browser support. FFmpeg is required and file_path must be specified.

arguments.name: file_name
arguments.description: override file name, defaults to name from file_path.

arguments.name: file_size
arguments.description: override file size, otherwise automatically computed.

arguments.name: file_hash
arguments.description: override file hash, otherwise automatically computed.

arguments.name: fee_currency
arguments.description: specify fee currency

arguments.name: fee_amount
arguments.description: content download fee

arguments.name: fee_address
arguments.description: address where to send fee payments, will use value from --claim_address if not provided

arguments.name: clear_fee
arguments.description: clear previously set fee

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: title of the publication

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: description of the publication

arguments.name: author
arguments.description: author of the publication. The usage for this field is not the same as for channels. The author field is used to credit an author who is not the publisher and is not represented by the channel. For example, a pdf file of 'The Odyssey' has an author of 'Homer' but may by published to a channel such as '@classics', or to no channel at all

arguments.name: tags
arguments.description: add content tags

arguments.name: clear_tags
arguments.description: clear existing tags (prior to adding new ones)

arguments.name: languages
arguments.description: languages used by the channel, using RFC 5646 format, eg: for English `--languages=en` for Spanish (Spain) `--languages=es-ES` for Spanish (Mexican) `--languages=es-MX` for Chinese (Simplified) `--languages=zh-Hans` for Chinese (Traditional) `--languages=zh-Hant`

arguments.name: clear_languages
arguments.description: clear existing languages (prior to adding new ones)

arguments.name: locations
arguments.description: locations relevant to the stream, consisting of 2 letter `country` code and a `state`, `city` and a postal `code` along with a `latitude` and `longitude`. for JSON RPC: pass a dictionary with aforementioned attributes as keys, eg: ... "locations": [{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}] ... for command line: pass a colon delimited list with values in the following order: "COUNTRY:STATE:CITY:CODE:LATITUDE:LONGITUDE" making sure to include colon for blank values, for example to provide only the city: ... --locations="::Manchester" with all values set: ... --locations="US:NH:Manchester:03101:42.990605:-71.460989" optionally, you can just pass the "LATITUDE:LONGITUDE": ... --locations="42.990605:-71.460989" finally, you can also pass JSON string of dictionary on the command line as you would via JSON RPC ... --locations="{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}"

arguments.name: clear_locations
arguments.description: clear existing locations (prior to adding new ones)

arguments.name: license
arguments.description: publication license

arguments.name: license_url
arguments.description: publication license url

arguments.name: thumbnail_url
arguments.description: thumbnail url

arguments.name: release_time
arguments.description: original public release of content, seconds since UNIX epoch

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: image/video width, automatically calculated from media file

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: image/video height, automatically calculated from media file

arguments.name: duration
arguments.description: audio/video duration in seconds, automatically calculated

arguments.name: channel_id
arguments.description: claim id of the publisher channel

arguments.name: channel_name
arguments.description: name of the publisher channel

arguments.name: clear_channel
arguments.description: remove channel signature

arguments.name: channel_account_id
arguments.description: one or more account ids for accounts to look in for channel certificates, defaults to all accounts.

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: account in which to look for stream (default: all)

arguments.name: wallet_id
arguments.description: restrict operation to specific wallet

arguments.name: funding_account_ids
arguments.description: ids of accounts to fund this transaction

arguments.name: claim_address
arguments.description: address where the claim is sent to, if not specified it will be determined automatically from the account

arguments.name: preview
arguments.description: do not broadcast the transaction

arguments.name: blocking
arguments.description: wait until transaction is in mempool

arguments.name: replace
arguments.description: instead of modifying specific values on the stream, this will clear all existing values and only save passed in values, useful for form submissions where all values are always set

commands.name: sync_apply
commands.description:
Apply incoming synchronization data, if provided, and return a sync hash and update wallet data.

Wallet must be unlocked to perform this operation.

If "encrypt-on-disk" preference is True and supplied password is different from local password,
or there is no local password (because local wallet was not encrypted), then the supplied password
will be used for local encryption (overwriting previous local encryption password).

arguments.name: password
arguments.description: password to decrypt incoming and encrypt outgoing data

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: incoming sync data, if any

arguments.name: wallet_id
arguments.description: wallet being sync'ed

arguments.name: blocking
arguments.description: wait until any new accounts have sync'ed

commands.returns: (map) sync hash and data

commands.name: sync_hash
commands.description: Deterministic hash of the wallet.

arguments.name: wallet_id
arguments.description: wallet for which to generate hash

commands.returns: (str) sha256 hash of wallet

commands.name: utxo_release
commands.description:
When spending a UTXO it is locally locked to prevent double spends;
occasionally this can result in a UTXO being locked which ultimately
did not get spent (failed to broadcast, spend transaction was not
accepted by blockchain node, etc). This command releases the lock
on all UTXOs in your account.

                        "value_type": "determines the type of the 'value' field: 'channel', 'stream', etc",
                        "protobuf": "hex encoded raw protobuf version of 'value' field",
                        "permanent_url": "when type is 'claim' or 'support', this is the long permanent claim URL",
                        "claim": "for purchase outputs only, metadata of purchased claim",
                        "reposted_claim": "for repost claims only, metadata of claim being reposted",
                        "signing_channel": "for signed claims only, metadata of signing channel",
                        "is_channel_signature_valid": "for signed claims only, whether signature is valid",
                        "purchase_receipt": "metadata for the purchase transaction associated with this claim"
                    }
                ],
                "outputs": [
                    {
                        "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                        "nout": "position in the transaction",
                        "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                        "amount": "value of the txo as a decimal",
                        "address": "address of who can spend the txo",
                        "confirmations": "number of confirmed blocks",
                        "is_change": "payment to change address, only available when it can be determined",
                        "is_received": "true if txo was sent from external account to this account",
                        "is_spent": "true if txo is spent",
                        "is_mine": "payment to one of your accounts, only available when it can be determined",
                        "type": "one of 'claim', 'support' or 'purchase'",
                        "name": "when type is 'claim' or 'support', this is the claim name",
                        "claim_id": "when type is 'claim', 'support' or 'purchase', this is the claim id",
                        "claim_op": "when type is 'claim', this determines if it is 'create' or 'update'",
                        "value": "when type is 'claim' or 'support' with payload, this is the decoded protobuf payload",
                        "value_type": "determines the type of the 'value' field: 'channel', 'stream', etc",
                        "protobuf": "hex encoded raw protobuf version of 'value' field",
                        "permanent_url": "when type is 'claim' or 'support', this is the long permanent claim URL",
                        "claim": "for purchase outputs only, metadata of purchased claim",
                        "reposted_claim": "for repost claims only, metadata of claim being reposted",
                        "signing_channel": "for signed claims only, metadata of signing channel",
                        "is_channel_signature_valid": "for signed claims only, whether signature is valid",
                        "purchase_receipt": "metadata for the purchase transaction associated with this claim"
                    }
                ],
                "total_input": "sum of inputs as a decimal",
                "total_output": "sum of outputs, sans fee, as a decimal",
                "total_fee": "fee amount",
                "hex": "entire transaction encoded in hex"
            }
